It's literally free, and although you don't have access to all features for free, it is only a dollar to get a premium account (and you can get all weapons with that dollar through trading) so there isn't a reason not to play it. And as a person with thousands of hours across various first person shooters like Call of Duty and Battlefield, I enjoy this 15 year old game more than any other FPS, and it is probably my favorite game of all time (other than maybe Hitman). It has a lot of unique playstyles across all 9 classes, while also not feeling like any class is too op or to weak, which isn't to say that it is 100% balanced, but it balanced enough that it doesn't feel like you are forced into any playstyle. The game is also made better through the source engine, which allows damage surfing and makes thing like rocket jumping possible. Overall, Team Fortress 2 is a fantastic example of a game that was polished and perfected to become a timeless masterpiece, and it's 9 classes mean that there is something for everyone to enjoy. I'd rate the game a solid 98/100 and maybe even more, it's just that great.

Team Fortress 2 is the pioneer of class based first person shooters. The impact it had on gaming is still being felt today. Because there is so much to learn about each character, you can put hours and hours into the game and never get tired at all. Community is great too, in every match I stumble upon friendly faces which is always a delight. So yes, play this game if you're an FPS fan like myself. It is simply endless fun.

Por cierto si eres alguien que te interesa el √°mbito de la compra/venta, pr√°cticamente todo el sistema de cosm√©ticos puede ser visto como un mercado gigante de oferta y demanda, as√≠ que hay mucho que se puede hacer en ese aspecto.

If you want a quick answer here it is, this game is awesome but in my opinion if you want to play only the official stuff then you¬¥ll have only like 30% of the fun. If you want to know some facts of the game before installing then here it goes:
- The official servers and gameplays are cool but after some time it may become kind of repetitive and boring, but fan-made servers can change little stuff like infinite ammo, instant respawn, dmg changes, etc. or do big things like create whole new game modes, also if you think the normal game is silly and funny the fan-made servers can be way better (no jokes here, seriously there¬¥re servers made to play only silly or fun modes like prop hunt, full random weapons, saxton hale, etc.)
- All the classes have multiple ways of play them but some of them are kinda useless or not very good to play (like almost every dmg medic or the combo axetinguisher pyro), but some others like the rocket jump soldier or the melee demoman are fun as heck so keep in mid that at first sight it looks that you can do a million different builds but a lot of them aren¬¥t good.
- You need to grind and have luck to get items, if you start to play you¬¥ll have very little stuff and this will limit your gameplay because you can¬¥t play mini-sentry engineer if you don¬¥t have the gunslinger, or you can¬¥t play the super agile anoying scout without the atomic punch nor the atomizer, etc. So don¬¥t expect to play all the stuff you have seen in videos when starting.
- Try always to play for fun, this is not a "i¬¥m so good that i¬¥ll carry the whole team because this is very serious" game; if you team starts losing a lot of people will simply change teams or go to other server (yup, there¬¥s no punishment), so if you want to play something very serious then this is not for you.
- Most weapons in this game fell kind of dull, as someone that played a lot of CS 1.6 in my middle/high school years when I tried this game I felt everything very weird and slow, I was kind of good with the sniper and scout but at the start I had problems to play properly soldier, demoman or even heavy.
